intro: Aeschynomene guadalajarana, commonly known as Guadalajara morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy flowers. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It has trifoliate leaves and produces pods that contain seeds. Aeschynomene guadalajarana is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
